atDirectives.name: @tailwind
atDirectives.description: Use the `@tailwind` directive to insert Tailwind's `base`, `components`, `utilities` and `screens` styles into your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @apply
atDirectives.description: Use the `@apply` directive to inline any existing utility classes into your own custom CSS. This is useful when you find a common utility pattern in your HTML that you’d like to extract to a new component.

atDirectives.name: @responsive
@screen
@variants
@layer
atDirectives.description: Use the `@layer` directive to define where styles should be injected into Tailwind’s CSS system. You can create custom styles inside `base`, `components`, and `utilities` layers.

atDirectives.name: @config
atDirectives.description: Use the `@config` directive to reference a Tailwind configuration file within your CSS. This is useful when working with frameworks like Vite or PostCSS.

atDirectives.name: @theme
atDirectives.description: Use the `@theme` directive to reference values from your Tailwind config inside your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @plugin
atDirectives.description: The `@plugin` directive is used to extend Tailwind CSS with custom functionality, such as additional utilities or components. It allows you to write plugins directly in your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @custom-variant
atDirectives.description: Use the `@custom-variant` directive to create your own variant selectors for Tailwind, allowing you to define custom conditions under which styles should apply.
